segment.source: Learn how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a Silverlight app for Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.0.
segment.target: Learn how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a Silverlight app for Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.0.

segment.source: AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight
segment.target: AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight

segment.source: AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight
segment.target: AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: This walkthrough shows how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a Silverlight app for Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.0.
segment.target: This walkthrough shows how to use the AdControl class to display banner ads in a Silverlight app for Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.0.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.
segment.target: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.

segment.source: Add the advertising assembly references
segment.target: Add the advertising assembly references

segment.source: The Microsoft Advertising assemblies for Windows Phone Silverlight projects are not installed locally with the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: The Microsoft Advertising assemblies for Windows Phone Silverlight projects are not installed locally with the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Before you can get started updating your code, you must first use Connected Services with the ad mediation support in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK to download these assemblies and reference them in your project.
segment.target: Before you can get started updating your code, you must first use Connected Services with the ad mediation support in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK to download these assemblies and reference them in your project.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, click Project and Add Connected Service.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, click Project and Add Connected Service.

segment.source: In the Add Connected Service dialog, click Ad Mediator and then click Configure.
segment.target: In the Add Connected Service dialog, click Ad Mediator and then click Configure.

segment.source: Click Select ad networks, select Microsoft Advertising only.
segment.target: Click Select ad networks, select Microsoft Advertising only.

segment.source: At this point, all the necessary Microsoft advertising assemblies for Silverlight are downloaded to your local project via NuGet packages, and references to these assemblies are automatically added to your project.
segment.target: At this point, all the necessary Microsoft advertising assemblies for Silverlight are downloaded to your local project via NuGet packages, and references to these assemblies are automatically added to your project.

segment.source: A reference to the ad mediation assembly is also added to your project.
segment.target: A reference to the ad mediation assembly is also added to your project.

segment.source: You will remove the ad mediation assembly reference in a later step, because it is not necessary for this scenario.
segment.target: You will remove the ad mediation assembly reference in a later step, because it is not necessary for this scenario.

segment.source: In the Select ad networks dialog, click OK.
segment.target: In the Select ad networks dialog, click OK.

segment.source: Click OK again in the following Fetching status confirmation page, and finally click Add to close the Ad Mediator dialog.
segment.target: Click OK again in the following Fetching status confirmation page, and finally click Add to close the Ad Mediator dialog.

segment.source: In Solution Explorer, expand the References node.
segment.target: In Solution Explorer, expand the References node.

segment.source: Right-click Microsoft.AdMediator.WindowsPhone81SL.MicrosoftAdvertising and click Remove.
segment.target: Right-click Microsoft.AdMediator.WindowsPhone81SL.MicrosoftAdvertising and click Remove.

segment.source: This assembly reference is not necessary for this scenario.
segment.target: This assembly reference is not necessary for this scenario.

segment.source: Code your app
segment.target: Code your app

segment.source: Add the following capabilities to the in the Capabilities node in your WMAppManifest.xml file.
segment.target: Add the following capabilities to the in the Capabilities node in your WMAppManifest.xml file.

segment.source: For this example, your Capabilities node looks like:
segment.target: For this example, your Capabilities node looks like:

segment.source: (Optional) Save your project.
segment.target: (Optional) Save your project.

segment.source: Click on the Save All icon or under the File menu click Save All.
segment.target: Click on the Save All icon or under the File menu click Save All.

segment.source: Add the Internet (Client & Server) capability to the Package.appxmanifest file in your project.
segment.target: Add the Internet (Client & Server) capability to the Package.appxmanifest file in your project.

segment.source: In Solution Explorer, double click Package.appxmanifest.
segment.target: In Solution Explorer, double click Package.appxmanifest.

segment.source: wp81silverlightmarkupsolutionexplorerpackageappxmanifest
segment.target: wp81silverlightmarkupsolutionexplorerpackageappxmanifest

segment.source: In the Editor, click the Capabilities tab.
segment.target: In the Editor, click the Capabilities tab.

segment.source: Check the Internet (Client & Server) box.
segment.target: Check the Internet (Client & Server) box.

segment.source: (Optional) Save your project.
segment.target: (Optional) Save your project.

segment.source: Click on the Save All icon or under the File menu click Save All.
segment.target: Click on the Save All icon or under the File menu click Save All.

segment.source: Modify the Silverlight markup in the MainPage.xaml file to include the Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI namespace.
segment.target: Modify the Silverlight markup in the MainPage.xaml file to include the Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI namespace.

segment.source: The header of your page will have the following code:
segment.target: The header of your page will have the following code:

segment.source: In the Grid tag, add the following code for the AdControl.
segment.target: In the Grid tag, add the following code for the AdControl.

segment.source: Assign the ApplicationId and AdUnitId properties to the test values provided in Test mode values, and adjust the Height and Width properties to one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.
segment.target: Assign the ApplicationId and AdUnitId properties to the test values provided in Test mode values, and adjust the Height and Width properties to one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You will replace the test ApplicationId and AdUnitId values with live values before submitting your app for submission.
segment.target: You will replace the test ApplicationId and AdUnitId values with live values before submitting your app for submission.

segment.source: Build and run your project.
segment.target: Build and run your project.

segment.source: Confirm that your app displays an ad, similar to the following:
segment.target: Confirm that your app displays an ad, similar to the following:

segment.source: wp81silverlightemulatorwithad
segment.target: wp81silverlightemulatorwithad

segment.source: Release your app with live ads using Dev Center
segment.target: Release your app with live ads using Dev Center

segment.source: In the Dev Center dashboard, go to the MonetizationMonetize with ads page for your app, and create a standalone Microsoft Advertising unit.
segment.target: In the Dev Center dashboard, go to the MonetizationMonetize with ads page for your app, and create a standalone Microsoft Advertising unit.

segment.source: For the ad unit type, specify Banner.
segment.target: For the ad unit type, specify Banner.

segment.source: Make note of both the ad unit ID and the application ID.
segment.target: Make note of both the ad unit ID and the application ID.

segment.source: In your code, replace the test ad unit values (applicationId and adUnitId) with the live values you generated in Dev Center.
segment.target: In your code, replace the test ad unit values (applicationId and adUnitId) with the live values you generated in Dev Center.

segment.source: Submit your app to the Store using the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Submit your app to the Store using the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.
